newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sweden has no comment on asylum for Peru rebels.
newsitem.headline: Sweden has no comment on asylum for Peru rebels.

text.p: Swedish officials on Thursday declined to comment on unconfirmed reports that Marxist rebels holding hostages in the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima, Peru, wanted political asylum in Sweden or Denmark.

Foreign Affairs Minister Lena Hjelm-Wallen said it was too early to comment on the reports which emerged in comments by released hostage Alejandro Toledo, a former presidential candidate in Peru, who overheard the rebels' talking.
"It seems a little far fetched but I really know nothing about it because I am not responsible for questions of asylum," Hjelm-Wallen told Swedish national news agency TT.
Deputy Foreign Minister Pierre Schori, who is responsible for asylum cases, also had no comment. "I must first find out what the situation is," he told TT.
Rebels of the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement stormed the ambassador's residence during a cocktail party on December 17, demanding some of their jailed comrades be freed.
The rebels are still holding 103 hostages.
